definitions.definition: arranged neatly and with everything in order

examples.text: I like everything to be **neat and tidy**.
The room was clean and tidy.
The place has never looked so tidy.
It was a neatly furnished and immaculately tidy room.
She admired the incredibly tidy garden.
Why does nothing ever stay tidy around here?
When we had finished the churchyard looked far tidier.

definitions.definition: keeping things neat and in order
a tidy amount of money is fairly large

examples.text: It must have cost a tidy sum.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from the noun tide + -y. The original meaning was ‘timely, opportune’; it later had various senses expressing approval, usually of a person, including ‘attractive’, ‘healthy’, and ‘skilful’; the sense ‘orderly, neat’ dates from the early 18th cent.
